Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of lawsuits lost by the U.S. in the WTO.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the U.S. actually wins the majority of cases it brings to the WTO.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the reason for losing lawsuits is due to having fewer judges than other countries, which is not supported by evidence.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the U.S. loses "almost all" of the lawsuits in the WTO.
Understate: The claim understates the success rate of the U.S. in winning cases brought against other countries in the WTO.
